Authors: Yulistiawan B.S., Prabowo H., Budhiastuti D., Gaol F.L.
Title: Maturity model to measure the government institutions of Indonesia (the environment bureaucracy of education) in the implementation of e-government
Authors with affiliations: Yulistiawan, B.S., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Prabowo, H., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budhiastuti, D., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Implementation of e-Government are expected to be solution in the care system, but in the process will be a challenge that has a risk of failure. In this study will result in a maturity model that becomes the size of maturity/readiness of a government institution when it will make the process of e-Government implementation. With the results of this dissertation study is expected to have the readiness of government institutions and the risk of failure of the implementation process will be smaller. © 2014 B.S. Yulistiawan et al.
Author Keywords: E-Government; Implementation; Maturity model; Risk of failure
Funding Text 1: This paper cannot be completed without funding and support from Doctorate Program of Bina Nusantara University and Ministry of Education and Culture.
References: Darmawan, N., The critical success factors study for e-government implementation (2014) Int. J. Comput. Applic; Niazi, M., Wilson, D., Zowghi, D., A maturity model for the implementation of software process improvement: an empirical study (2003) J. Syst. Software, 74, pp. 155-172; Valdés, G., Solar, M., Astudillo, H., Iribarren, M., Concha, G., Conception, development and implementation of an e-government maturity model in public agencies (2011) Gove. Inform. Q, 28, pp. 176-187
